Awards & Achievements

Brit Awards

The iconic Brit Award trophy

Wins & Nominations

  • 1995: Best British Breakthrough Act
  • 1996: Best British Album (What's the Story Morning Glory?)
  • 1996: Best British Group
  • 1996: Best British Video (Wonderwall)
  • 1997: Best British Group
  • 1998: Best British Group
  • 2007: Outstanding Contribution to Music

Oasis dominated the Brit Awards during their peak years, winning multiple awards and delivering memorable performances and speeches.

NME Awards

Notable Wins

  • 1995: Best New Band
  • 1996: Best Band
  • 1996: Best Album (What's the Story Morning Glory?)
  • 1996: Best Single (Wonderwall)
  • 1997: Best Band
  • 2000: Best Band of the Decade

Record-Breaking Achievements

Album Sales Records

  • Fastest-selling album in UK history (Be Here Now, 696,000 copies in first day)
  • Third best-selling album in UK history (Morning Glory)
  • Eight consecutive UK number-one albums
  • Over 75 million albums sold worldwide

Concert Records

  • Largest demand for concert tickets in British history (2.5 million applications for Knebworth)
  • Fastest-selling stadium concerts in UK history (Knebworth, 250,000 tickets in one day)

Chart Records

  • Eight UK number-one singles
  • Twenty-two consecutive UK top 10 hits
  • Spent 765 total weeks in the UK Singles Chart

Other Notable Awards

Q Awards

  • 1995: Best New Act
  • 1996: Best Album (Morning Glory)
  • 1996: Best Live Act
  • 2005: People's Choice Award
  • 2006: Classic Album Award (Definitely Maybe)

Ivor Novello Awards

  • 1995: Best Contemporary Song (Whatever)
  • 1996: Most Performed Work (Wonderwall)
  • 1996: International Hit of the Year (Wonderwall)
  • 2010: Outstanding Song Collection (Noel Gallagher)
